page.title: 04ECOLOGY OF GLENLUCE
page.content: Along this coast of emergence, naturalised dunes form the only acid dune SSSI in Scotland.{TORRS WARREN,} unfortunately is all prohibited to the public, for it is a Royal Aircraft Establishment bombing range. Rare flora and insects are not accessible This site is also historically important,for here the first Irish boat people landed in the 4th century, and began to establish the old Scottish Kingdom of{DALRIADA.}The archaeological finds are on display in Stranraer museum.Rising from coastal sand and sandy loam,is undulating clay and blanket peat.There is some coniferous forest, but indigenous rowans,pines and heathers underline the acid habitat. Cormorants breed on inland lochs, and oyster catchers (sea piets) nest up to 6 miles inland. No endangered species though otters rare.
